text: Taster at Eggspectation Chantilly. Pours brown with a thin head. Massive pumpkin and booze on the nose. Lots of booze on the tongue along with the rum and the huge pumpkin spices. Finish lingers a bit. Definitely not for the faint of heart.
Tap @ Eggspectation Chantilly- Pours deep orange brown with no head, but a few tiny bubbles. Aroma is fabulous, rum, brown sugar, pumpkins, seeet potatoes, and all things autumnal.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, bottled on 8/17/2016. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy deep orange/copper color with a 1 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with good retention, that reduces to a spotty lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of huge pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, ginger bread, vanilla, rum, toasted oak, toffee, brown sugar, and brown bread; with light notes of molasses, chocolate, cocoa, dark fruits, herbal, and oak/toasted earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of pumpkin, spices, bready malt, and rum barrel notes; with big strength. Minimal booziness as it warms. Taste of huge pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, ginger bread, vanilla, rum, toasted oak, toffee, brown sugar, and brown bread; with light notes of molasses, chocolate, cocoa, dark fruits, herbal, and oak/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal/spice bitterness and rum/oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, ginger bread, vanilla, rum, toasted oak, toffee, brown sugar, brown bread, light molasses/cocoa, and herbal/oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of pumpkin, spices, bready malt, and rum barrel flavors; with an awesome malt/bitter/spiciness balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Light dryness from bitterness and rum/oak spiciness, increasing through the glass. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, and fairly sticky/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden; a small increasing warmth, with mild barrel booziness lingering after the finish. Overall this is an amazing barrel aged imperial pumpkin ale! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of pumpkin, spices, bready malt, and rum barrel flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to sip on for the enormous ABV. Absolutely perfectly balanced between malt, spice, and rum barrel complexity. Great barrel presence without being overly boozy, tannic, or drying. After less than 9 months of age, this is already ready to go. The 17.5% is exceptionally well masked. A highly enjoyable offering.
12oz bottle pours a brown color with a bit of head. Pumpkin pie aroma. Nice spice balance and they go so well with the run barrel.

Pours a yellowish orange clear colour with lots of sediments floating about. No real head building up. Ugly beer. Nose is pretty intense with thebolscher and sweet and sticky, boozy pumpkin. The taste is very rich and again sweet and boozy. Definite pumpkin but not detecting the rum barrel. Just getting a little spice like clover or cardamom in the finish. Gets sticky sweet and boozy in the aftertaste. Not a fan of these October beers but had hopes for this one. Turnes out I have yet to try a nice pumpkin beer.

How: Bottle, batch 5.
Where: Tasting at hackobock, 2017-04-22.
Appearance: Clear amber colour with a quickly fading, off-white head.
Aroma: Spices, pumpkin, rum, caramel, alcohol.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Spices, pumpkin, sweet, alcohol, rum, caramel.

April 22, 2017. Bottle at home, bottled September 9, 2015. 
Light hazy orange red with a minimal head and alcohol legs. Aroma is malty, spicy and warming with caramel, rum, cloves, earthy spices.
Taste is sweet, spicy and boozy. Medium to full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is warming alkohol, spicy and sweet rum and caramel. 
Sweet, boozy and spicy.
Bottle, at hackobock tasting.  Cloudy amber, no head. Vodka, pumpkin and rum up front. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Intensely boozy. Fireball like stuff. Vile.

Deep amber color out of the bottle with a thin beige head. Big boozy nose with some spice cake notes. This is a very nice dessert sipping beer. I cant get past the pumpkin roll/cream cheese frosting sweetness of this. Rum, pie spice, sugar, cream cheese, and dark fruits. More beer should come in rum barrels.
Bottled. Pours honey orange, no head. Aroma is pumpkin, cream soda, little sour, some rum. Lots of pumpkin, sweet cream, cream soda, maybe some sweet potato, rum, very sweet, boozy.

Bottle at Deansos last THT. Almost clear amber with small bubbly beige head. Huge pumpkin, banana bread, strong spices, caramel, toffee, bitter herbs and alcohol, strong cinnamon, marzipan. Lots of sweet dessert nd strong spices. Very sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied.

Bottle shared at Deans Last THT. Clear amber with a ring off white head. Aroma of pumpkin, spice, cinnamon, caramel, toffee, woody barrel notes and rum. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Shared at deansos last THT. Pours a clear amber with almost no head. Very spicy, nuttmeg, cinnamon, ginger, pumpkin, caramel. Not as boozy as expected. Quite sweet. Full body, low carbonation.

33cl bottle shared with friends.
No head. Clear amber pour. Pumpkin aftertaste. very good
An intense beer. There not getting around the effects of the alcohol, but it doesnt feel all that boozy. Very rich, deep pumpkin, spicy flavor. Barrel aged richness.
Aroma is pumpkin, nutmeg/spices and liquor/whiskey. The flavor is pumpkin, nutmeg/spices, malts and a mix of alcohol, whiskey/liquor and very warming in the finish.

oh my this was good. poured a gold/orange hints color. the aroma straight up was booze and pumkin and rum. the warmer this one gets the better I liked it. excellent rum and pumpkin flavors with the booze on the end and its not hidden at all it stands there in all its glory.

Appearance: Rich copper brown. Mostly clear. Almost no head. 
Nose: Rich caramel, rum notes. tones of oak and pumpkin. Hint of spice. 
Taste: Boozy and huge rum alcohol hit. Notes of pumpkin and spice line up well with the alcohol
Body: Medium to fuller. 
Parting thoughts: My second Rum barrel Pumpkin of the season. Far superior to the first. everything blended together very well.
Bottle. This is perfection of the pumpkin ale. All hail rumpkin the best pumpkin brew on the shelves.

Imperial Pumpkin Ale brewed with pumpkin puree and a blend of five spices. Aged in extremely fresh Gosling’s Rum barrels for six months. Consume early and often, preferably with a pumpkin pie and/or s’mores.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is a pumpkin ale taken to the extreme. Pours a light, cola brown, almost watery, with little to no head. Aroma of pumpkin pie spice. Flavor is also dominated by pumpkin pie spices, with more than a little rum, lots of booziness to this one. Be careful, with that alcohol content.

On tap at Warrens Ale House in Wheaton, IL., listed 16.7% abv. on the menu, as a full 5oz. serving, displaying a clear & bright, amber hue, with a frothy layer of off white/cream colored head foam, and doily-like cling to the lacing. The aroma was sweetness as caramel, brown sugar, and candied berry & cherry. Pumpkin and an array of pie spices rounded out the nose. Full bodied, with soft carbonation, the texture was syrupy & sticky, the taste was similar notes as the aromas, dessert-like, quite sweet, yet smoothly boozy, and very flavorful.

Batch 6, Bottled August 17, 2016, 17.5% abv.

Dark burnt orange color, translucent, with off-white ring of a head, and no lacing. Aroma has strong pumpkin and rum notes- great blend, not boozy at all. Flavor is syrupy, sweet, with sharp alcohol notes at first, but as it settles, the rich pumpkin, spices, and rum are noticeable. Very interesting, but at $15 for a 12oz bottle- I may never buy another, and not necessarily worth the money.

Batch 04-2014 -- 12 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Translucent brown color, boozey nose, zero head. Flavor is boozey and delicious. Pumpkin comes through, but the spices have fallen out. Tastes like a dessert, decadent and full.

Hazy copper and bronze coloured body with a non-existent head, some subtle shades of orange and a nice peach and ruby glow. Aroma of alcohol, bourbon, grain, maple syrup, candy, rich toasted malt, pumpkin pie spice and some honey - strong and surely potent. Full-bodied; Super strong and dense rich squash flavour with some bourbon, oak, malt, grain, maple syrup, pumpkin/squash, pumpkin pie spice and extra allspice thrown in, all with a ton of leftover alcohol. Aftertaste shows some boozey notes with grain, squash, syrup, toffee, caramel, oak, vanilla and a bunch more alcohol - super rich, and definitely noticeable with double digits abv! Overall, a good, but very rich and decadent squash-based beer with a ton of sweetness and even more alcohol tucked in. Good to try and even better that this was on draught. I sampled this ten ounce pour on draught at Whole Foods in Pentagon City (Arlington), Virginia at the end of my driveway on 18-October-2016 for US$9,00.

Very strong alcohol overtakes everything else. Could only drink a little of this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle, Batch No. 5, bottled Sept 9, 2015. 18.0% ABV. Served in a DFH snifter, the beer pours a burnt orange color with about an inch light tan head that fizzled away quickly. Lacing is OK, and there are some floaties noticeable too. I like the aroma, the brew smells like rum, nutmeg, cinnamon, pumpkin, allspice and some ginger. For the most part I think the taste is similar to the aroma, but with the addition of some brown sugar and graham crackers. Mouthfeel/body is full, its coating with a moderate amount of carbonation. Drinks easy enough for being 18% ABV. Its still a sipper, but a pretty good one. This is definitely worth picking up! $12.99 a bottle.
Looks like apple cider. Smell is booze, more booze, and spices. Sweet up front, cinnamon in middle, and alcohol burn as it goes down. Noy a big fan of pumpkin beers, but this one is pretty good.

Pours a dark mahogany with a thin white head. Aroma is rum, graham cracker, nutmeg, cloves, cinnamon, and pumpkin. Flavor is a mix of rum barrels, pumpkin, and pumpkin pie spices. Sweet, heavy, boozy, and warming. Yes, it is a bit strong and it may work better with less alcohol, but its still quite good.

Sept. 09,2015 batch #5 ABV. 18.0%. Pours dark amber with a bunch of floaties and thin wispy film and collar. Aroma is strong nutmeg clove pumpkin pie filling from a can and rum booze. Taste is sweet and boozy with plenty of spice which comes off astringent from the booze. Palate is full slick somewhat chewy and very warming. I dig it, strong sipper.

Bottle. Orange copper color. Aroma of pumpkin spice, booze, red fruit and malt. Flavor is strong, with lots of pumpkin spice, cinnamon, booze, malt and a alcoholic finish. Really heavy, its nice, but would be better with less alcohol.

Why consume with pumpkin pie. It is pumpkin pie. Wow it is like eating pumpkins with cool whip. Thanksgiving? Crust and all is here. Wow. Thick on tongue thin head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle, shared at RBAG by me. Deep orange amber. Delicious sweet rum and pumpkin cake, sticky and rich, warming but not at all harsh. Exceeded expectations-- absolutely delicious!

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Caramel, toffee, gourd, alcohol...so much sugar, rum
Adjunct: Rum, toffee, tablet, carrot; deep reddish amber; fucking amber
Golden orange, huge wafting rum aroma, pumpkin spice and booze.. Very boozy but delicious rum and pumpkin. Amazing
Bottle - Rum and sweet potato. Cloudy copper with no head. Sweet potato, pumpkin, spice and nice rum notes. Heat on the throat. Sweet and nice.
2015 bottle. Pours a dark orangish color. Aroma and taste are lots of sweet rum, pumpkin, and spices. The age has helped the hotness.
Pours a bright orange color with minimal head. Fall, pumpkin aromas with little rum barrel that gets better as it warms.

Draft into tulip. Golden red-orange, light tan head. Mildly clouded. Allspice, cinnamon, brown sugar, pumpkin. Very sweet, maybe a hint of bitterness. Very upfront alcohol, but only medium to heavy body, very chewy. Reasonable amount of acidity. Reasonably oily. Pretty darn good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 bottle. Aroma is boozy rum, pumpkin, cinnamon, nutmeg and clove. Tastes pretty boozy too but still smooth considering the abv. A little overly spiced but not too bad. An intense sipper for sure. I bet Id love this with a little less spice and a lower abv.

Bottled 09.09.15. Poured 03.08.16. A: Very sweet. Molasses, pumpkin puree, cloves, nutmeg, and cinnamon. A: Fizzy 1/3 finger head that quickly fades to a small ring. Very hazy dark red body. T: Follows the nose with additions of oak woodiness and caramel. P: Its pretty syrupy, but some bubbles are there on the back end. O: Midway through the glass, it almost tastes like a nice barleywine. Its good, but Pump[KY]n is better.

My two favorite drinks have come together in one awesome glass! I enjoyed a sample of this fine drink on draft at Union Jacks. The beer poured a dark ruby color with a small but lacing tan head. The nose featured pumpkin, rum, caramel malt, ginger and nutmeg. The flavors were so dang delicious! I could taste the rum literally being lifted away from the rest of the liquid as I swirled it around on my palate. The rum just sprang out and shared the spotlight with the pumpkin. This is amazing! Super smooth finish with a touch of booze on the tongue. Forget the pie and smores. Ill take the bottle.
Bottle: Poured a reddish caramel with little to no head. Aroma was super rum spicy and pumpkin. Taste had that spiced rum effect with nice pumpkin.

Bottle poured into snifter. No head, legs running down the glass, cloudy amber color, tons of sediment. Huge aromas of sweet rum, nutmeg, pumpkin and an astringent finish. Flavors of dark rum, raisins, prunes, pumpkin and nutmeg. Very interesting beer, boozy, sticky, rum driven. It definitely warms you up.

Bottle. Pours a rather hazy dark amber color with a lot of floaties and a small head on it. Nose is heavy on the rum and sugar, but with a fair amount of pumpkin coming through as well. Taste is sweet and quite a bit boozy, but with a nice bit of spice coming through. Im not a fan of rum or pumpkin, per se, but I like this a lot more than I expected to.
Flaska från whole markets nyc. Orange med vitt skum. Söt doft av pumpa, kanel och rom. Kryddig smak av pumpa och kanel med värmande alkohol

From Batch #2 from Sept. 17, 2012. Poured in a Konings Hoeven wide mouth chalice. Pours brown with minimal head and lace. Aroma of rum raisen puddin with extra malts and rum! Medium carbonation and big mouthfeel. Flavors or rich malts, brown sugar, rum, cinnamon spice, slight clove, molassas. Overall big, bold, sippingly delicious!

12 ounce bottle bought at Uptown Market. Pours a clear mahogany chestnut color with a small white head that dies down to nothing. A massive boozy spicy nose, the rum/pumpkin mix is wonderful. Sticky sweet, big sugary rum, spices, pumpkin but the overall flavor isnt nearly as boozy or difficult as a 18% pumpkin beer would seem to be. Hot cherries, burnt toffee, rum and heat in the finish. Quite good. For what it is, this is awesome.
Bottled, orange amber color, still, spicy pumpkin rum aroma, flavor is bananas foster, rummy sweet, bread pudding,great finish

12oz bottle, bottled SEPT 09 2015, foiled. Nose explodes with real pumpkin and traditional pie spice, really explosive and inviting; a little sugary, but waves of vanilla, cream, cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, apple, lesser allspice and faint ginger [the latter turns up more in the aftertaste]. Pours deep amber-brown with a fizzy tan head that isnt long for the world. In the mouth, quite sweet but stopping just a step short of cloying, sugary, light-medium bitterness, and a huge fireball of scorching alcohol, not bold enough to ruin the taste buds, but enough to throb the throat and chest for a while. Stronger caramel and thicker malt as I go, touch molasses/treacle. Getting a lot of vanilla and barrel character, definitely oaky and tannic, but not so dramatically distinguished that Id pick out rum. Full body but not fat, picking out more berry with time, even some maple in the sweetness, but unfortunately the great pumpkin impression fades as the cleansing, antiseptic spirit character grows to dominate all else  I feel like Im doing shots after about three ounces. Still, for one of the bigger beers [at 18%], pretty well done, flavorful and stays on-topic without collapsing into a fuselly mess like some of Averys other offerings. Im actually going to recommend this, as a sipper during a deep freeze, long after the lights of the jack-o-lanterns have guttered. [2015.12.10: 3.4]
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Brown caramel pour. Huge pumpkin aroma. Taste is really boozy pumpkin. Really good but too boozy for me.

Some things just go great together. Peanut butter and jelly. Coffee and cream. Rum and pumpkin. At this years GABF, Avery entered the big-batch PumKYn (bourbon barrels are near ubiquitous), rather than the small-batch Rumpkin (rum barrels are rare). Seeking greater profitability? Going with a crowd-pleaser to be judged against over-specified style guidelines by a room-filling number of judges? Whatever the reason, beer competitions are a poor (pour?) way to discover the great beers of this world. Better to keep an open mind and educate your palate through tastings (outside of competition!), preferably of beer on draft at a local brewery/bar. As to the latter point, see Mark Dredges "Tropical Fruit Juice IPA (or IPA in 2015)", 24 November 2015.

A fine ale. My personal taste isnt very compatible with the strong rum flavor though I can tolerate it because the great spices blend well with it. It warms all the way down to the bottom of the belly. Im happy I decided to give it a try.

2011 vintage. Pours hazy burnt orange color with thin off white head. Aromas of rum, oak, pumpkin pie spices. Similar flavor with some booziness. Medium to full body with minimal carbonation. Good stuff.
Glowing dark amber pour with thin soapy head. Big boozy spicy aroma. Rich pumpkin, Sugar and spice. Big booze bomb that warms you up. Pretty good when your in the mood.

Served in a tulip. Burnt caramal color with little head and lacing. Aroma is pumpkin pie spices, toffee, and lots of malt. Flavor is more pumpkin pie, rum, and deep wood. Heavy mouthfeel and alcohol is present. Good beer.

Aroma: caramel, pumpkin, alcohol, pumpkin spices
Appearance: cloudy amber, off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Awesome

Beautiful reddish orangish amberish with an off-white head. Aroma of pumpkin and spices, rum barrel, caramel, dark fruit, and molasses. Taste is deep and rich, boozy, spicy, sweet, and fruity. Full bodied, syrupy, boozy, and lightly carbonated. Excellent.

Rich amber/cider color; Medium body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, vanilla, pumpkin, some dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, caramel/vanilla, molasses, rich pumpkin, and spice; Warm boozy finish; Nicely balanced; Interesting & pretty smooth.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 12oz bottle poured into a snifter. The aroma is a strong pumpkin pie spice, with some light boozy undertones that turn towards caramel and candy corn with notes of sweet apples and wood emerging late. Its a hazy, honey hue with coarse, soap-like, white head that thins quickly with a runny, and light retention, and no lace. Its taste profile is very highly sweet with a medium light bitter contrasting note. The tecture is thick, and syrupy with a sticky touch and a small amount of fuzzy carbonation. The full body has a mild boozy front with caramel, rum sugar, and roasty pumpkin pie. It finishes with a strengthening spice, warm alcohol, and a fruity touch. The aftertaste is woody with spiced alcohol and cooked sugar. Near mid glass, this turns to burnt bread crust and bitter spice.

From bottle on recommendation of a friend. Pours hazy copper color with a half-finger off-white thin head that dissipates quickly and leaves just a hint of foam around the edges of the glass. Aroma is big and sweet and autumn spicy. Taste is immediately sweet and spiced with cinnamon and nutmeg, orange gooey candy, and of course, pumpkin. Its hot and boozy. Medium to light mouthfeel with good carbonation. A hint of hoppy bitterness in the finish. While tasty, its too sweet and hard to finish.
Clear light brown with no head. Aroma is pumpkin pie, malt, booze, spices. Full bodied, lightly syrupy mouthfeel, sweet and spicy on the palate. Taste is pumpkin pie, rum, booze.

Bottled Sept. 22, 2014. Alc. 16.73% by Vol.: Pours brown with an amber hue and minimal khaki head. Head retention is poor. AROMA: rum, pumpkin, banana, spices, herbs, cooked vegetables, malt, caramel, vanilla, herbal hops, oak chard barrel, roasty, earthy, brown sugar, molasses, smoke, BBQ sausage and slight barnyard bitter funk. TASTE: dark spiced rum, sweet pumpkin, banana, spices, herbs, cooked vegetables, hop spice, malt, caramel, vanilla, oak chard barrel, roasty, earthy, brown sugar, molasses, smoke, BBQ sausage and slight barnyard bitter funk. AFTER TASTE: dark spiced rum, molasses, brown sugar, sweet pumpkin and herbs with an oily boozy spiced finish.

October 30, 2015 - bottle from AV3 back in 2014 while carving pumpkins. Light brown pour with limited head. Aroma was strong spice and sweet rum. Taste was sugary sweet with some alcohol and spice. Cinnamon really came out as it warmed.

On tap at Global Brew. Pours an amber/red with a small off white head. Aroma is pumpkin and nutmeg. Taste is sweet toasted malt that is somewhat cloying, but not over the top. There is also plenty of spice, some pumpkin, a smoked and buttery, bready malt taste along with that barrel aged scotch taste. Really busy beer with ABV and warmth coming in at the end. A terrific concoction that is truly a sipper.
Clear amber. This tastes like pumpkin wine....not much to add then that. Tasted at Elijah Ps Monsters of Beer festival.

It pours a clear copper colour with a small fizzy head of foam that doesnt last long. 18% abv...so not surprising. 

The smell is all pumpkin spicy with heaps of nutmeg, some cinnamon, and an abundance of rum, which is one of my favorite of the hard Liquors. 

Taste reflects the smell to a T. Lovely spicing that makes you, or at least me, yearn for a slice of pumpkin pie. 

Beyond the apparent spices and the well integrated rum barrel aging, theres a profound presence of caramel malt and another spicy thing going on that reminds me of ginger. Pretty darned sweet but thats a way to get the abv up to where it is, eh? 

Medium body and carbonation. 

This is delicious, outstanding, and hides the abv as best it can. A real treat(pun intended) at $12.25 for the 12 ounce bottle.

Amber body with minimal head. Looks like a cognac. Aroma of pumpkin, nutmeg, cinnamon, and booze. As a sipper, this is pretty good. Quite sweet, but it almost needs to be to offset the high abv. Not something I could drink often but a nice unique beer. Better flavors come out as this warms up.
Bottle shared by Jack - thanks! Deep orange pour. Super rich pumpkin pie spices. Oily and slick. Boozy. Awesome!

Bottled 9/22/14. This is one big ass beer. Lots of everything in this. Im not gonna bore you with details. Just get one and sip it over an hour or so and taste it change. Gotta get one to age a couple of years

cloudy copper color with a thin white head that disappears. aroma is pumpkin, pumpkin pie spice, and booze. Flavor is pumpkin spice, brown sugar, spiced rum, and vanilla. hides the ABV up front but has a nice mild warmth on the way down.

Tap. Clear orange ruby brown copper. Nutmeg, allspice, alcohol, brown sugar as well in the aroma and dark fruit sweetness. Flavor is quite sweet and alcohol does sneak up, brown sugar, toast, dry bitter nutmeg in the finish and lingering alcohol burn. Medium to thicker viscous boy with decent carbonation. I thought I would either love this or hate it, and I actually find it somewhere in between.

Holy gross. Im not sure why I bothered smelling this after it poured cola with thick boogers of floating nonsense. Sticky sweet aroma with pumpkin and overpowering cinnamon, clove, and all spice. Aggressive cinnamon on my tongue. Burning alcohol. Burnt sugar. Aggressive sweetnes. Long spicy alcoholic finish. Gross Avery, as usual.
Bottle Clear deep copper/amber. Big malty caramel brown sugar aroma. Sweet and boozy but well attenuated for the high ABV. Clean and very strong. A well done very strong sipper.
12oz bottle thanks to Chris. Pours out a copper amber topped with a ring of ahead. Nose is pumpkin spice sweetness barrel vanilla and plenty booze. Taste is more of the heavy sweetness pumpkin spice.

Aroma rum, pumpkin, pumpkin spices, 
Appearance orange, cloudy, minimal head, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, heavy sweetness, 
Palate medium body, full body, average carbonation, 
Overall I find this beer absolutely amazing. I am a rum person so this fits with my tastebuds very well. For me its not overly sweet and it is well made. The alcohol is well hidden for 18%. This is a one and done. I can feel the warmth all the way down to my stomach. I would suggest this beer to a friend who really likes rum on the rocks.

Draught at Publick House, October 2014.Clear, drab copper-beige with some light auburn tints and a small, fleeting beige head.Alcohol, pie spicing, candied fruits and not a ridiculous amount of rum or pumpkin (though theyre certainly both present). With warming, obviously, the booze and spice do get pretty unbearable.First sip is sweet, nearly syrupy but for the loosening effect of the rum/booze. Warm pumpkin pie and spices makes an appearance but is massively outdone by the candied sweetness. Light citrus and fruitiness on the edges. Low carbonation not helping the cause, leaving a heavy, cloying, boozy effect on the palate. How anyone rates this thing above a 2 is beyond me....Just disgusting.

What do you do when someone brews a 16.7% Pumpkin Ale and ages it in rum barrels... You age it some more in hopes it mellows out. Well I must report that this has barely done that, still aggressive and is even sweeter than it was fresh. Avery keeps it crown (over Founders, Southern Tier and Firestone Walker) has the producer of the most hard to drink big beers in the USofA. There are parts of this that on their own are tasty... I like the bold rum notes and the spices alone are a brash hit to the groin but when you add it all together, it is a confluence of overbearing spice, booze and cloying sweetness that just does not work. Diabetes with a side of Pumpkin spices. Argggh!

Shared with the boys on July 5th at Residence inn in Boca. Small pours were dark brown and syrupy. Aroma is BAM pumpkin, spices, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, and dark chocolate. The taste is simply delightful with the pumpkin, spices, deep caramel, vanilla, and dark chocolate notes. Thick body and oily. Not as boozy as it was when I had it fresh. Very good.

Bottle. Pours amber brown with a thin tan head. Aroma was boozy pumpkin pie with rum, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla. flavor was very boozy and quite sweet with brown sugar, vanilla, caramel, cinnamon, pumpkin pie, and nutmeg. Full body, syrupy texture, low carbonation.

Bottle. Medium brown pour, disappearing head, aroma is pumpkin pie, for the most part. Nice to have a pumpkin beer that hits that mark for a change. Flavor is sweet, pumpkin, spice, booze at the end, with some bitterness showing up. Enjoyable, with limited use.

From notes on 3/29/15

On Tap. Glad I got the 6 ounce pour. Not that it isnt good, it is just soooo sweet. Might as well be drinking a glass of rum. Tastes basically like a rum candy.
This was a very unique beer... Think sherry meets port meets fruity beer. Very sweet with a syruping like texture. A beer to share, maybe not worth the premium

Sweet pumpkin taste, awesome, delicious. It tastes like rum and pumpkins. Nice carbonation. I love this 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells like a sweet roasted pumkin mash with rum. Oaky, woody, complex pumkin flavors with rum backing. Sweet but not overly for how strong it is. Most authentic pumpkin flavors of any I have had in a beer and the rum flavors go awesome with it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[Tap] Muddy light brown color with virtually no head on top. Heavy aromas of pumpkin pie spice, vanilla, booze and sweet potatoes. Flavors of yam, pumpkin puree, alcohol, nutmeg, allspice, cinnamon, vanilla, rum and clove. An alcohol burn is there, but not overpowering considering the high ABV. Oily palate. Lightly carbonated. About 4 oz. of this stuff is all you need. Tasting notes from 10/2014.

So pumking was the best pumpkin beer Ive ever had.. Till I tried this. Pours a muddy orange/brown. Aromas are absurdly pumpkin like. Pumpkin pie, pumpkin cookies, pumpkin loaf.. You get the picture. Very sweet, almost sherry like pumpkin sweetness and brown sugar. Alcohol is extremely well hidden.. A nice warmth going down the gullet.. And a great buzz shortly thereafter. Awesome stuff.
Bottle to snifter. Hazy copper with hint of tan head. A: spicy, boozy, vegetable. T: sweet boozy spicy pumpkin. Just too much.

Pours a dark black color with a tiny little head. Aroma is boooooooze, rum, raisins, oak, sugar. The taste is, well, its so much booze. Overwhelming booze. I like pumpkin beers. I like rum. I like Avery for the most part but this? This was not done well in my opinion. Maybe 2014 produced an unusually harsh bash. I loved the Pumpkyn beer they make thats the same strength. This one was just not good. Age it for 10 years and maybe it will have mellowed.

Bouteille 33cl via trade shared with the Shape folks, Belgium. 2013 bottle. 
De couleur ambrée-orangée, col blanc qui disparait rapidement.
Arôme offre un bouquet agréable de citrouille le tout accompagné par un bouquet efficace dépice all-spices qui ne tombe pas dans lartificiel. 
Palais offre ici tut le bon côté de la citrouille. Une certaine épaisseur sen dégage avec une pointe de douce. Le rhum accompagne le tout et est en symbiose avec le profil attendu de cette bière.Le tout reste collant aux lèvres sans pour cela tomber dans le trop sucré. Retrouve un épicé (cannelle, girofle) typique de saison et cette impression de pumkin pie sur stéroïde. 

Bière difficile à boire seul et nous nétions pas trop de 4 pour y arriver.

Many thanks to Michael for the bottle.

Pours a clear, firey dark red color, with a soon vanishing head.

Has an almost overwhelming, wooden barrel character, which gets enhanced by an incredibly zesty, herbal, sweet spiciness, featuring glazed pumpkin and burning booze, all put into an intriguing balance. The brews complex, honeyed maltiness interacts well with the slighty fermented, earthy and sweet pumpkin, both smells blending together hold the barrel intensity at bay.

This is so much sweeter than I expected it to be, with loads of molasses, toffee and cane sugar, kicking my teeths in, finished off wih an intense alcoholic burn, while the barrels woodenness gets almost swallowed entirely by the sugar. The malt foundations gets overpowered by the sweetness already during the very beginning, joined by a sharp alcoholic impact, and only manages to try finding its balance during a later stage, due to the calming herbs and spices, which all in all arent capable to stop the sugar madness too. The rum barrel is very well integrated though, providing a burning, slightly bitter counterpart to the sugar, which would result into a slightly dry, medicine-like impression, if it wasnt for the muddy, leafy herbs of mace, cardamon and vanilla, to provide some sort of balance. FInishes with caramelized malts among molasses and an confirming booziness, leaving enough space on the palate for the actual pumpkin to fit in, supported by wooden herbs.
Bottle pour at home. Batch #4 bottled sept 22 2014 16.73%. Slight pumpkin aroma, smooth finish , leaves a small amount of rum after taste. Really good beer here, I enjoy everything from this brewery.

Incredibly delicious pumpkin beer. Lots of sweetness, but its big alcohol cuts through it well, balancing things out. Texture is thick and chewy with a mild carbonation. Intensely rich elements of pumpkin pie, bread dough and pastries. Pleasant hoppiness. Alcohol is hidden dangerously well. Yams, rum and raisins linger nicely in the aftertaste.

Clear amber/brown color , thin off-white head. Aroma of rum , pumpkin, spices and malt. I like rum , so I like this smell either. Heavy sweetness in taste . Excess of sweetness as for me . Also there are spices , grain , pumpkin and some alcohol in taste. Warming , alcohol finish and aftertaste. Very interesting , but I expected for more...

2013 12-oz. bottle. Heavy nose of strong rum and molasses, nutmeg, and ginger with hints of cinnamon and actual pumpkin aroma (not just the typical spices). Crystal-clear dark copper in color with no head. Incredibly rich taste of straight-up pumpkin pie (crust and all) and maple syrup; hot booze is quite apparent but not particularly rum. Slick mouthfeel. Delicious but maybe another six months in the cellar would smooth it out.

12 oz bottle. Bottled on Sep/2013. 18.53%. From jcnielsen. Huge thanks to Justin!
Hazy amber brown colour with a small light tan head. 
Sweet malt, sourness, pumpkin sweetness, spices, rum and more sweetness in the aroma. 
The flavour is... Wow! Its really strong with spices, sweetness, rum, alcohol and more sweetness. Extremely strong. The alcohol burns. This is not a light beer... Im passing out.

12 oz bottle wearing the foil avery uniform. Pours an amber color with a sweet banana aroma. Caramel and sweet pumpkin with an amazing spice compliment. Ripe banana finish. Smooth and delicious. What an awesome beer.

[6551-20140723] Bottle. Fresh rummy leaf grains aroma with a hint of sweetly barbecued meat. Hazy, brown body with a quick bubbly head. Boozy rummy grains flavour has a taffy rum undertone. Medium-full body. Really interesting. (7/2/8/3/14) 3.4
(w/ DuctTape, jercraigs, JoeMcPhee)
A mess for my tastes. Syrupy. Too much BS pumpkin spices like clove, cinnamon and other stuff. Super sweet. Maroon clear pour with ok head and lacing. Tap at Churchkey.

Bottle: Thanks, Brandon. Modestly clear amber body with a ruby-red tint; a prickly, light-tan head quickly transitions into a small, foamy collar. Huge pumpkin pie aroma; fleshy gourd, coated in vanilla, sweet rum booziness, sticky caramel & toffee drizzle, nutmeg, cinnamon, sweet cream, & a very minor floral aspect hidden underneath. Flavor has a huge, syrupy caramel bite up front, sifting into a strong pumpkin flavor. Not just pumpkin spice, but actual pumpkin flesh. Sweet pumpkin, though, & it never transitions into that strange vegetal territory. Heaps of sweet vanilla cream, nutmeg, sticky rum, toffee, cinnamon, ginger, honey coated & toasted graham crackers, with a nice spike of earthy bitterness tipping off the finish. Sticky sweet, warming finish. Huge beer, very sweet & quite boozy, but still doesnt seem like almost 17% ABV. Very tasty stuff, although I think I like Pump[KY]n just a touch better.

Bottle. Clear amber. Big pumpkin pie aroma. Rum vanilla sweetness on the taste with fall spices. Barely any alcohol on the feel, warm finish. Very good. Top-tier pumpkin brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a weird hazy apple cider color. Aroma is pretty much straight pumpkin. Taste adds some maple syrup, rum and alcohol heat. Malt backbone gives it a bit of a pumpkin bread character. Thick sticky mouthfeel. Really good.

My bottle reads 16.73 ABV. Its an Avery brew so I expected big and boozy and thats what it is. Thankfully though you can still taste the pumpkin and spices and its not alcohol hot just boozy. Still though its just to damn big and insanely sweet. Glad I tried it though. I certainly wont buy a bottle ever again though as I cant bring myself to pay $13 for a 12oz thats unnecessarily big and sweet.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy roasted and caramel for the malt, light cooked orange for the hops, moderate dough and broth for the yeast, with notes of butterscotch, nutmeg and rum. Head is small, wispy, off-white with no lacing and is fully diminishing. Color is clear copper. Flavor starts heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately to heavily sweet and faintly bitter. Palate is full, syrupy, with a mostly flat carbonation and a heavily alcoholic finish. This Pumpkin Beer should be slightly warmed and sipped slowly as you would a bourbon in winter.

Keg at Beer Run, 11/4/14. Batch 4. Pours a clear copper with a thin white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of caramelized pumpkin, brown sugar, spice, lemon, rum. The taste is rum, toffee, caramel, raisin, pumpkin, rye, dark fruits. Medium bodied, low carbonation. A little hot but not bad to the alchohol content.
AndyReynolds said: Pretty damn good pumpkin beer. The alcohol stands out for sure. Typical pumpkin pie aroma with stronger pumpkin vs. spice, subtle rum.
12 oz bottle. Deep amber with a decent beige head. Aroma is of pumpkin pie, rum, toffee, oak, and caramel. Taste is of cane sugar, rum, oak, pumpkin, cinnamon, and brown sugar.

12 oz bottle. Batch No.4. 16.73%. Bottled Sept 22, 2014. Reddish Brown pour. Malty toffee caramel boozy nose. Big blast of pumpkin spice flavors, with alcohol burn mixed with Rum, caramel, vanillas, toffee. Quit smooth and very rich. Finish burns. What a big beer. This starts the Holidays with a bang.

Bottle, 11/22/2014. Pours a clear ruby mahogany color, thin yellow beige head fades quickly to a still surface. Aroma is pumpkin, pie crust, cinnamon, nutmeg, touch of rum barrel with vanilla, booze. Taste is similar, pumpkin pie filling, heavily spiced, with rum, big boozy finish. Thick body. Alright, but verging on one-note only.

Wham bam thank you mam. This is a mo-shit 
Ass kick of a beer, I kid u not. Plenty of heat, what a 
Ride of what 18%? Thing is its a silpper
And a shotglass type heady drone.
OK seriously very tasty full bodied 
Light carb, powerful, pumpkin spice pirate
Arrrgghj!

Perfect balance of pumpkin essence, pumpkin spices, and rum.

Syrupy (but not too syrupy) body, and a very sweet, but not quite cloying flavor, thanks to a dash of dryness from the ginger.

The alcohol is beautifully masked for 16+ percent, and the finish is nearly endless.

Pumking WAS my favorite pumpkin ale until I savored Rumpkin.
Lot of oak, rum, cinnamon. Pours a nice burnt orange/red. Nice flavor, rum,sweetness, tannins, spices. Delicious stuff
Pours red brown. Aroma is rum, woody, alchohol, pumpkin, cinnamon. Taste is sweet, caramel, rum, alcohol, rum, pumpkin.

GABF 2014. Great beer. Very sweet, but not to the point that I cant drink it. I can taste and smell the rum, but it is surprisingly well hidden as far the palate where I do not feel the alcohol. Thick and heavy. Caramel; and pumpkin pie spices. This is too heavy for a 12 oz, put this in a nip bottle.

12 oz bottle  thanks Brian (mrhoppy)! Aroma is upfront soy sauce and rum. Blah. Swirling it around unlocks caramelized brown sugar, Christmas spices, rum. The beer pours inky black out of the bottle with quickly fading mocha head. The taste is much better than aroma, but still a bit cloying. Light roasted pumpkin, spices, brown sugar, dried fruits, molasses, rum. Body is medium-full, with seemingly zero carbonation and a slightly sticky finish. After taste is definitely barrel heavy, sweet rum and light booze. Its not very hot, which I do dig. Overall, its focused, but not really my kind of beer. I can appreciate the craft in making something this big.

Pours hazy bronze with a ring of beige for the head. The aroma has bourbon, rum, alcohol, fusal, some light pumpkin and toasted rich malt. It has a very thick and chewy body with some light sharp carbonation. The taste is very rich and thick malt, brown sugar, toffee, sweet rum, alcohol heat and soft spices. The finish shows some pumpkin and lots of alcohol heat. This is interesting - very rummy and hot.
Bottle at Park & Co. Denver. Wow! Nice pumpkin flavor with strong rum alcohol. Slow sipping bomb!

Oh my! Clear dark amber pour with small beige head quickly dissapating. Aroma of rum, pumpkin, burnt sugar, caramel and chocolate. Taste of caramel, burnt brown sugar, creamy chocolate, pumpkin, nutmeg, cinnamon. All balanced out nicely with the rum aging. Full bodied, low carbonation, lots going on in this beer, absolutely delicious and potent.

Bottle (16.73% ABV/Bottled on 9-22-14). Dark amber pour with a thin layer of sudsy beige foam. Strong notes of caramelized pumpkin, candi sugars, cinnamon and rum-soaked ginger bread in the aroma. The taste opens up with a heavy dose of fresh pumpkin pie filling, rum, burnt brown sugar and vanilla along with some nutmeg, honey and port wine toward the end. Mouthfeel is ultra thick and syrupy with low carbonation and more rum and pumpkin spice in the finish. Overall, its sweeter and boozier than Id prefer but still an enjoyable Halloween treat.

Pours a clear bright orange copper color with little head or lacing. Aroma is sort of smoky with some dark caramel and gourd. Taste is initially sweet with some caramel and gourd flavor. Some sweet bread and woody barrel character along with rum, spices and alcohol flavor and warmth very apparent. Finishes with some sweetness and warmth. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Too much alcohol for my taste.

A light tea brown color with a tiny bit of off white head around the rim. Smells of woody oak, earthy, pumpkin, rum. Taste is a super sweet caramel pumpkin, a little smoke and char, rum, spiciness and or alcohol burn at the end. It's a bit much, as expected, and needs to stay in the cellar for a few years. An ok blend of spices, and the pumpkin isn't over done. Rum character shows pretty strong. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A garnet orange color. Aroma is like a fried hamburger with some pumpkin. Taste is alcohol with burnt sugar, briney and sweet, with spices at the end. The rum is underneath it all. Medium, warming mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

So sweet and strong. The sweetness works well with the pumpkin pie concept. Malt is intense. Booziness leaves an aftertaste and a warming sensation. I detect the pumpkin, but it doesnt taste particularly fresh, and Im not sure I like it; the spices might be enough. Overall a good concept, and it would be good to share in small glasses as a dessert. Well executed for such a huge beer.

Bottled. Poured mostly clear, deeper amber with a short-lived toasted beige head. The aroma picked up a whole helluva lot of rum, raisins, and vanilla upfront, with pumpkin meat and nutmeg following.. airy, peppery alcohol on the back of the nose.. smelled very sweet and strong. The flavor opened tart with rum barrel and peppery notes.. syrupy middle with raisins, dried apricots, pumpkin, and molasses.. spicy alcohol and sticky, boozy sweetness around.. finished syrupy-sweet and very strong, with lots of vanilla and rum.. not as much pumpkin. Heavy-bodied and syrupy as mentioned on the palate.. very thick, very sweet, and very strong.. some interesting stuff in there, but it was not easy to drink.

12oz bottle to snifter. Amazing aroma of pumpkin pie and booze. Dark amber brown pour. Thin lasting tan ring. Loads of sweetness with muted spice that doesnt overpower. Some alcohol burn as it warms. Sticky sweetness on the gums.

12oz bottle - 2013 vintage - pours a dark rusty orange . Big rum alcohol aroma with some spice . Palate is sticky and syrupy . Taste is super sweet , pumpkin spices , mild alcohol burn on finish . Interesting . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle of the batch number four @16.73 percent. Pours golden orange with very little foam. Aroma is herbs and pumpkin. Taste is very smooth and easy drinking for something with such a high alcohol content. Rum, molasses, cinnamon and other spices. Body is medium, much thinner than other Avery barrel series, with low carbonation. Very good, surprisingly drinkable.

slight beige head that fades slowly. amber brown colour. aroma is cardamom, cinnamon, nutmeg and very boozy. taste is like aroma, extremely sweet and boozy. medium body rather carbonated. tasted 13 and 14 side by side, with the 14 being better. i get the idea behind the beer, but after a few sips i already had enough and my palate got wrecked. lets put the remaining beer to good use and make rhum cake out of it :P bottle 65cl

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy, burnt sienna, thin film-like head with not much retention. Nose is sweet and dessert-like, lotta pumpkin, pie spice, dates, dried fruit, brown sugar, caramel, rum and vanilla. Mouth is syrupy and clings to tongue. Big sweetness (like sweeter than pie filling), nutmeg, cinnamon, caramel, cardamom, pumpkin, candied yams , rum extract, slight tannin finish, lotta booziness. Overall, I liked the Beast and the Samael from this collection a lot more. This one is a little too sweet and cloying... not to mention overpriced for what it is. All Souls Day anyway.
A very boozy beer. Something you definitely want to sip. Has a oily feel in the mouth. A good sweet pumpkin taste that lingers on the tongue. Would definitely get again.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2014 12 oz bottle, bottled Sep. 22. 2014, only a little over a month ago. $14.99 for a 12 ouncer?!  Aroma is like boozy pumpkin pie with clove and nutmeg standing out, raisin. Pours murky amber with a dissipating beige head that laces a little. Taste is like a boozy decadent pumpkin dessert, much like Pump[KY]n, but even better. This is a lot like that beer, but its more palatable. Slick oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, heavy body. Nice, but its a sipper that needs to be enjoyed while wearing a smoking jacket and a fat cigar in hand while sitting in a home library and shit.

12 oz bottle, batch no. 4, 16.73% alc by vol.- Pours muddy orangeish brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is coconut, rum, oak barrel, pumpkin, some fruit, melon or something like that. Taste is nice pumpkin, pumpkin spice, cinnamon and nutmeg, heat burn to be expected, coconut, oak, rum. Extremely complex, I can see why they put these beers in 12 oz vs 22 oz, like a boozy dessert, but I couldnt take much more than this.

Aroma of strong rum and spice. Flavor is very intense at first. Hot rum flavor mixed with sharp pumpkin spice. Seemed a little rough at first but it settled in nicely. Ended up being very smooth with only minimal burn. Honestly it came across like a nice Barleywine with strong sweetness and toffee notes but nothing too cloying or overdone.

$15 bottle shared with TJ. Pours amber with a hint of beige head. Aroma is caramel, potato, vegetal, booze. Flavor follows. Starts sweet caramel, cinnamon, then gives way to vegetal, clove, nutmeg. Boozy oaken rum finish. Makes for a nice well balanced sipper.
Drinking from bottle pours amber almost mahogany aromas of caramel and alcohol. Upfront taste is sweet with hints of caramel and booze. Finish is slightly spicy with a nice lingering alcohol end.

Aroma is pumpkin/squash, malt sweetness, caramel, oak and the slightest hint of alcohol. Look.s amazing - reddish brown color with a white head of foam that recedes to nothing immediately. Tastes like caramel, oak, pumpkin pie and dark rum. Very hot; a sipper for sure. The instant rum heat gives way to a wonderful sweet aftertaste. Palate is good with low carbonation. This is almost a liqueur; it would be a great after dinner drink. I loved this one, even when taking into consideration its tremendous amount of hype and huge price tag ($11.99 for a 12 oz. bottle). Definitely worth it - anyone who is reading this should try Rumpkin.
Pretty damn good pumpkin beer. The alcohol stands out for sure. Typical pumpkin pie aroma with stronger pumpkin vs. spice, subtle rum.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Smells of ginger and pumpkins. Appearance is ruby red. Taste is a thick, sticky pumpkin and caramel with notes of sweet rum alcohol. This beer sticks to your mouth like warm caramel and is quite spicy, as a result the taste lingers around for a good while!

Deliciously potent brew. The only knock I have is with the aroma. At room temp its fine, but put the slightest chill on it and it gets weird...boozy cardboard for lack of a better phrase. Outside of that little hiccup this beer is really good. Color reminds me of a glass of Crown. Boozy flavor...lotsa rum here. I really like the subtle spice hints behind that rum blast. What a great sipper!
Way too sweet, for the raving reviews and the overall taste I find it extremely overpriced. I dumped it.

Bottle enjoyed at Mayor of Old Town in Denver. Deep burgundy hue, packed with floating particles. Soapy bubbles form then dissipate as quickly as they came. Vanilla extract hits first in the nose, with alcohol-soaked oak. Below you get molasses, maple, pumpkin, ginger, nutmeg. Sweet. Flavor is intense -- very hot coming through the nose, almost too boozy to let sit on the tongue. It burns! Candied molasses and a bit of raisin blend in the front; cinnamon and pumpkin roll in the back. Expansive medium body, sugary but not thick. Heavy but not viscous. Hot as hell. Too intense to enjoy more than a few ounces of. A liqueur.

Holy shot. To sweet to drink much, but... pours a reddish copper. Aroma is spiced pumpkin and alcohol. Taste? I want this on rum cake. Beautiful. Ok, it is still great, but this one you share. I would not want to finish a whole one.

Pours a beautiful ruby/amber. Scents of rum, apples, pumpkin, caramel & spices. Solid right out of the gate, and gets even better with decanting into your favorite snifter. The rum/pumpkin combo makes this the best "pumpkin" brew I've had to date. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2014 16.73 AVB, bottled 9/22/14 [on-bottle] alcohol, raisin, vanilla, banana, butterscotch, resin, floral, caramel, nuts, toast, roasty, cereal, clear, red, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, full body, thick feel, average carbonation, average carbonation,

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear amber color with a thin rim of light tan head. Aroma is strong malts, pumpkin, spice, rum, boozy. Flavor is quite boozy, heavy malts, pumpkin and spice. Full body with a huge boozy kick, long lingering into the finish. Good beer, but definitely a commitment to put this one down!

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2016 12 nov 2016, bottle. nose is boozy, sweet, sweet potatoes. sweet, boozy. pumpkin spice is nice, not too strong and alcohol is strong enough to balance it. i really like this. i think it is better than the pumpkin.

(original rating - 838317 = 3.9)
24 oct 2014, bottle. Light Amber, clear, some bubbles. Nose is pumpkin pie, even the crust! Med body and fizzy. Pumpkin pie! Maybe the best pumpkin beer ever! Nov pumpkin pie, balanced spices and a lot of pumpkin. Really good.

Orange and ruby colored. Aroma of pumpkin pie spices, booze. Taste is spicy and sweetness up front and rum booze in finish. This is a very sweet beer, maybe too sweet. The bottle suggested pairing with s'mores so I had some graham crackers and it helped a bit. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear deep amber with an ecru head. Aroma of pumpkin spices and caramel. Flavors of rum and spices. Sweet, somewhat cloying finish. Warm, boozy finish.

Poured from bottle into snifter. Pours a dark orange, almost brown with a 1 finger head that is white. Head dissipates some, but not fully. Aroma - very obvious rum presence with some pumpkin notes underneath as wel as mild spices. Taste - lots of rum notes, brown sugar, spices, and a bit of a burn from the alcohol. Good lord this is tasty.

Deep orange bordering brown. Nose is full of fruity rum, thick and heavy, with faint pumpkin and mild spice. Flavor is more heavy-handed fruity rum, finishing with pumpkin pie filling and mild spice. Lingering rum. Huge dissapointment. The barrel muddied this beer to a fault.
GABF 2014. Brown color with a small head. Very boozy aroma. Strong but non-descript alcohol aroma. Lots of molasses and brown sugar. Very malty. Light spice notes.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 Bottle (12oz $15): Pours a golden brown with no head. Aroma rum. Tastes very sweet with a little pumpkin and spices. Rum warming and sweetness in the end. A very good desert beer.
Update: 1/1/2015. Much sweeter than I remember.... too sweet (was 3.9 not 3.7)

Bottled September 22, 2014.
Glass: Duvel tulip.
Appearance: Clear and deep garnet hue with a tall but thin tan head that dissipates to a fuzzy coating.
Aroma: Sweet rum, brown sugar, vanilla, oak, and pumpkin are all here. A dash of cinnamon is noted. Aroma leans sweet and complex, really nice.
Taste: Sweet rum, brown sugar and caramel are huge here, with vanilla accenting them. Underlying pumpkin is noted during the mid-taste with some cinnamon. The finish adds a sugary coating with pumpkin being more noticed, adding a vegetal presence on the finish. This is sweet and a dash boozy, but I think it delivers exactly what most people would expect.
Palate: Thick and mildly carbonated.
Overall: Darn good despite being sweet. I expected a big, sweet and complex beer and this delivers. Its pricey, but I think that its worth trying once.
Deep plum color with a brown tint. Aroma is straight up pumpkin. White head. Boozy, smooth, sweet, pumpkin flavored barley wine. Warms a bit which is nice just getting into this fall weather.

Golden brown pour with no head. Awesome rum, oak, and pumpkin pie aromas. Flavor is a sweet medley of flavors. Lots of molasses and sweet pumpkin pie spices. Slightly warming on the finish but doesnt taste anywhere near the abv. Very good.

Bottle. Pours brown with red hues. Aroma is brown sugar, pumpkin, vanilla, sweet. Taste is very sweet, almost syrupy, medium bodied, light carbonation, a bit of heat. Overall good but extremely sweet...

Dark cognac brown pour... Aroma of pumpkin, spices, rich purée, and rum... Burns the nostrils... Flavor is outrageously intense, rich caramel, pumpkin purée, and spices, with lots f rum burn on the finish... Very noticeable alcohol... Enjoyable, but maybe a little too hot

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear red brown pour with a tan head that settles down to a ring. Aroma is sweet pumpkin pie, rum, wood, and cookies. Taste is pretty sweet. Booze helps to settle it down a little but its not too hot or overpowering. Pumpkin and spices are pronounced as well. Slick texture with a little warmth on the way down.

Poured from bottle to glass. Deep copper hue with off white head. Aroma is nutmeg, pumpkin, cinnamon, clove, caramel, oak. Mouthfeel is great with a full body and soft carbonation. Taste is sweet throughout with a drying wood finish. Overall this is an absolutely fantastic brew.

Aroma: Sweet potatoes, black strap molasses, tropical fruit and subtle pumpkin on the nose. Appearance: orange-amber body with quickly dissipating white and foamy head. Steady carb bubbles and little lacing; fat alcohol beads. Taste: sweet potato fries, maple syrup, cinnamon waffles and juicy pumpkin pie. Hell of an alcohol burn, but the burn is good. Palate: sticky and full bodied. lively carb on the mouth, but not enough to make this pumpkin syrup refreshing.

Clear darker orange color, minimal head, some lacing/retention. Aroma is boozy alcohol with notes of pumpkin, clove, spices, some caramel. Full bodied, alcoholic, sticky, sweet, big sugary pumpkin flavors. Not really a fan.

"2011 batch comes in at a whopping 15.90%. Holy crap. Even though its rum, the booziness in the flavor and especially the aroma is reminiscent of Angels Share. Boozy and really not much like i had imagined, but a very enjoyable sipper nonetheless. more like a liquer or cordialthan a beer. big aroma and flavor of booze, rum, light spices and molasses. nice carbonation and head for a beer so strong. pretty sweet and pleasantly warming. not the first thing i;d reach for when wanting a pumpkin beer, as the pumpkin and spices are relegated to the background, but as an after dinner sipper - very nice. *several months later, less heat, spices and pumpkin definitely shine a little more. very good both times, but its definitely changed."
2013-18.5% just as good if not better

2011 bottle. 2000th rating! Pours hazy copper with almost no head. Smells like alcohol, fermenting pumpkin, light spice. Tastes like pumpkin vegetable and pie, light alcohol, brown sugar, spice. Very smooth and strong. Light/medium body and low carbonation.

Bottle thanks to beerandblues2; thanks! Pours clear copper with a trace of head. Aroma is bready malts, pumpkin, vanilla, rum, light spices, and some woody notes. Flavor is dry with pumpkin and vanilla sweetness blending well with the rum and oak flavors along with some toasted malts and mixed spices; dry, lightly boozy finish. Medium/full body and light carbonation.
(Backlog) Draft at avery event at blind tiger. Brune pour with tan head. Pumpkin, rum and a bit of alcohol aromas. Rum barrel dominates flavors, some lighter pumpkin tones.

Thanks for jercraigs. Deep amber pour. The nose is quite spicy with a bit of soft sweetness and some nice fruitiness. Its got a bit of light chewiness. A bit of leathery character with some nice boozy character. Has a rummy sort of sweetness and some booziness. Theres an unusual sort of vegetal bitterness on the back. A bit of lingering sweetness. Decent.

2014-07-23. Lightly hazy dark amber brown body with a small tan head that fades. 3+ Aroma of hot alcohol, sweet dark malt, fruit, pumpkin, light spice. Flavour is rich, sweet dark malt core, alcoholic rum, sweet pumpkin, lingering alcohol on the tongue. Smooth average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3++ Love it except for the prominence of the alcohol. Bottle via trade with BlackIPA

0.355l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. Lots of unfiltered floaters going on here! The beer itself is lovely amber in color and the small bubbly head that came on the pour quickly vaporizes. Oh, my theres lots of nose here! Super woody and barreled we have a lacto sourness in the background. The rum rules this beer, super infused with sour red berries and sweet rum. Damn, it smells a lot, and Im willingly admitting that I really like this aroma. Super cloying in the taste. Its rich and almost cut-through thick in the mouth while the carbonation level is below average and prickling. Pumpkin-gingerish taste with red sour berries, wood and lots of rum. The alcohol is most definitely present but not disturbing in any way whatsoever so ever. Peppery stingy pumpkin spicy finish that lingers on into the late hours. A super interesting, flavorful and fun beer! Perhaps the best pumpkin ale Ive ever had. 18.12.2013

Bottle split at the Manny G tasting, thanks to Bruce, 28/06/14.
Murky orange amber with a moderate beige swirl and edgeing.
Nose is big old pumpkin fuel, light spice, dark fruit rinds, ginger notes, caramel fudge.
Taste comprises sticky pumpkin pie mix, malty, rich caramel, light spice, touch boozey syrupy.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, smooth on the palate, sweet licks in the close and subtle booze tones in the close.
Solid pumpkin affair, really not getting the 18% which is expertly integrated, thought I was drinking 7 or 8 % worth of autmunal pie filler !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Bruce. Pours unclear amber-copper with a bubbly off-white head. The nose has ripe pumpkin, caramel, some wood, orange. Medium sweet flavor with boozy kick, rich pumpkin syrup, some autumnal spices. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Hot finish, caramel, sugar syrup, rich pumpkin, bread. Heavy-hitting stuff but pretty tasty. Not bad.

Bottle thanks to Bruce? It pours deep mahogany brown with minimal head. The nose is wood, soft fruits, pumpkin, earth, spice, vanilla, butter squash, and candy. The taste is bitter-sweet, wood, squash, pumpkin, spice, vanilla, wood, light alcohol with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation, a big pumpkin bastard, but decent enough.
Sample at Hopfest 2014. Comes reddish brown with a small beige head. Aroma of spice, pumpkin, and malt. Taste is rum, ginger, cinnamon, pumpkin, and malt. Nice sipper.
Draught at Beer Trappe. Big boozy rum based beer where the ABV clearly shows. A bit sticky at the end, but very tasty.

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2014 Bottle, 2013 thanks to OKBeerFan! Pours hazy chestnut amber with a small quickly dissipating tan head that leaves a ring and some lacing. Aroma is rummy for sure, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, light funkiness, toffee, orange zest. Lots of pumpkin flesh present. Flavor has all of the above, fairly spiced, quite boozy. Sweet and sticky, only a bit of bitterness. Very rummy. A bit too sweet and spiced for me to really get into. Nothing even remotely subtle about this beer. Holy cow. Updated with a 2014 bottle thanks to Brian - same impression, but a bit more balanced perhaps.

Bottle generously shared by Sparky! Mahogany pour with slivers of orange, garnet, and plum at its core. Caramel, toffee, molasses, maple, pumpkin, nutmeg, raisin, and run soaked oak. Pretty damn sweet and syrupy. Alcohol was absolutely invisible. A bit sugary for my liking.

12oz bottle shared thanks to Lukaduke! Nose is weird musty old spices, rum, wet cardboard, and something I cant seem to place along the lines of baked beans and the meatballs that come in Spaghetti-Os. Taste follows the nose with a soft viscous palate, notes of spices, pumpkin, cheap rum. Finish is the same but does hide the high ABV very well. Just a weird one for me.

2011 Bottle thanks to adnielsen ! Pours a deep caramel color with a finger of eggshell foam. Tons of boozy pumpkin, coconut soaked rum, kola nut, ginger, caramel popcorn, baseball card bubblegum... some earthy leather helps calm down the sweetness factor. Nice spice factor.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish malty spicy woody pumpkin aroma. Sweetish malty spicy woody caramel and pumpkin flavor with hints of rum. Has a sweetish malty spicy woody pumpkin and rum finish.

Really loved this beer. Thanks to Westmeister for sharing with me at Grant Park. Scent is spicy earthy pumpkin. Despite a single bottle having the alcoholic equivalent of 4 average lagers, the booze is well hidden. Flavor has cider like quality. Lively carbonation, which is pleasing to me, maybe not to others. Bottle - Shared by Westmeister

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 2012 bottle. Admitted Avery fanboy for their special brews. Love the booze. Shared with EricTeusink in Grant Park. Pours murky mostly still orange with some noticeable stuff in the bottom of the pour. Smell is spice, rum, booze, big sweet. Taste was big sweet rum soaked malt ball. Medium thick mouth with minimal carbonation. Hints of it reminded me of cider. Booze is prevalent throughtout but not something that I couldnt easily do a full 12 ounce. Just delicious stuff here.

Bottle chilled in a bucket of snow during the snow storm in Baltimore. Pours a softly hazed amber brown with a thin white head. Huge sweet alcohol on the nose, soft rum and wood, a bit of oxidization. Medium-bodied, sweet and certainly boozy right away. Warm and spicy, a good amount of wood and a lot of warming alcohol. Still a bit boozy on the finish, but rather tasty. Nice sweetness and caramel notes into the finish.
Boozy rum pumpkin spices and oily thick sticky mouth feel. That pretty much sums it up. Was going to do a full bottle by my lonesome but was lucky to have a friend help me out with it.

Bottled sept. 17 2012. Pour has a dark murky amber in color with a ring of off white head. Aroma has pumpkin, pie spices, sweet rum barrels, and light heat. Does have the distinct Goslings rum aroma once it opens up. Mouth feel is medium and the carbonation low. Flavor is not bashful about the alcohol blasting you out of the gate. Heavy thick malt core, seasonal spices, caramel sweetness, vanilla, oak, and rum. Goslings house flavor all over it with the base beer packing heat even with 1 1/2 years of aging on this bottle.

This perfect incarnation of a pumpkin beer has a light, alcohol-infused fruit and spice aroma thats perfectly soft and elegant. Its sweet, alcoholic aroma is both creamy and woody and perfectly balanced. Its an amazing beer overall, mature and deliciously well-crafted. Notes of soft, but potent, alcohol gently graces the finish, while a touch of ginger makes the robust sweetness and spiciness much more mellow. Its out of this world. If you stumble across a bottle of this, throw down the cash for it. Its worth it.

Great brew all around, great aroma of gourde and malt,spice. Taste brandy oak and somewhat of cinnamon. Caramel sweet, very nice alcohol warmth. Tons going on and just a great and fun, for lack of a better word, to drink.

Old note. I believe it was shared up at Proof: Huge aroma. Boozy, sweet. Cinnamon, red hot spices, vanilla. Pretty balanced for how crazy it is. I had no idea at the time that is was this high ABV. 7.4

Poured from the bottle it looked like a glass of brandy. Thick and rich. Aroma was more brandy,pumpkin and oak. Add in a touch of honey. Taste has pumpkin, brandy cinnamon and spice. Very warming, feels like i should be sipping by a fire. Long finish.

Bottle share thanks to Homo321. Pours a copper, orange color. Pumpkin, booze, toasty, spices, and more alcohol in the nose. More pumpkin, spice, booze, rum, in the flavor. Very smooth and high boooooost!

Bottle share from homer321! Aroma is strong mix of spice, rum, malt, pumpkin. Pour is cloudy amber with almost no head. Taste is lmix of strong spice, rum, little heat. Really nice, I feel warm inside.

Bottle share at Proof courtesy of scotchzi. Opaque orangey amber. Zero head, but who cares? Aroma reminds me of hot cider: spice (cinnamon, clove) sweet almost burnt sugar, and pumpkin replaces the apple, but there is a touch of baked apple too. Taste is very similar, but a warm spiced rum comes through too. Thin-medium body with almost no carbonation; but who cares? Extremely well thought out brew, and yummy as hell. Maybe my new favorite pumpkin?

2-yr old bottle shared by Dave. Aroma of slight nutmeg spice, sweet potatoes, brown sugar and oak. Pours orange and sticky with very little head. Taste is pumpkin sweet spice up front but quickly vanishes into pure sticky booze. Non-descript sugars and slight oak. Certainly a party for the mouth but nothing really stands out other than the booze.

Bottle- Huge thanks to Wchesser..No clue why I havent had this before..2013 at 18.53%abv bottle..Pour is ruby with flakes and a bubbly head that fades to nothing..Nose is chewy caramel, pumpkin pie soaked in rum, alcohol on the nose, cinnamon, spices...Taste is nice soft pumpkin pie filling with a nice chewy caramel, vanilla, spices, nice rum, all the flavors stack right after another.. alcohol is very well hidden on the taste..

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 18.12.2013, 0,35l bottle sampled @ BBGTC Christmas tasting:
Small bubbly mediumlasting head. Aroma is spiced and boozy, caramel malts, dark sugar, alcohol, pumpkin, gingerbread, grass, oak, spices. Taste is sweet, caramel malts, dark sugar, oak, citrus peel, vanilla, toffee, pumpkin, gingerbread, alcohol. Longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a deep amber clear body with a tiny light beige head. Nose is big sugary rummy barrel notes with caramel, toffee, alcohol, brown sugar and hints of port wine and nougat. Taste is big sweet sugary rum tones, alcohol, wood, caramel and hints of pumpkin and cardamum. Full body, medium carbonation. Very, very nice big sipper from Avery.

Hazy deep golden with a small head. Heavy rum / oaky notes. Sweet and lightly spiced. Alot of alcohol here yes.. Taste is very sweet with hints of spice. Rum and oak in abundance.. Nice in small portions.

Pours a hazy orange from the bottle with no real head or lacing. Aroma is sweet and boozy, slight rum and vanilla. Taste is sweet also, but a nice cinnamon candy spice note. Burns on the way down, but still smooth, very nice.

Batch number 3. Bottle. Spiced rum aroma, pumpkin, cinnamon,clove, nutmeg, and alcohol. Sweet caramel, marshmallow, licorice, roasted pumpkin, and rum flavors. Heavy body. Boozier, at 18.53%abv... yikes. Glad Im sharing this.

Batch #3 bottle that I picked up in San Diego for $13.99. Better be good. Part of a 2-man tasting alongside Good Gourd Almighty and Almanac Heirloom Pumpkin. Pours a slightly cloudy dark orange without much head. Aroma of spiced rum, pumpkins, a little cinnamon and nutmeg. Flavor is sweet caramel and light butterscotch, a little pumpkin fruit, light cinnamon and nutmeg spice, brown sugar, a bit of marshmallow cream. The sweetness is very nice here. Alcohol warmth is like whoah, as expected. Sweet, not quite syrupy mouthfeel with medium to low carbonation. Overall I like this a lot, and it is a huge improvement over the disappointment that was Good Gourd Almighty that we had right before this one.

Bottle. Pours a deep red. Minimal head that dissipates to nothing. Nose is full if caramel and pumpkin spices. A little heavy on the cinnamon. Light barrel. Taste is similar and a bit sweet. Warming hits about 5 seconds after the sip. Not boozey at all. Wow. This is great. Just wish it was 8% instead of 18!

Bottle at home. Deep amber pour with a small diminishing head. The aroma is high toasted malty with sweet spicy and pumpkin notes. Some oak as well. The flavor is intense sweet with obvious pumpkin notes. Nutmeg and cinnamon too. Heavy and alcoholic. Light roasted finish. A true sipper. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 12oz in Muskogee on Thanksgiving day in a hotel room with my dad and brother in law. My dad doesnt love it, but he refuses to give me the rest of his glass, what the heck. StefN jinks its amazing, he is fascinated by the fact that it is aged in rum barrels: " where does a brewery in Colorado get huge rum barrels?" 

Pours brown cloudy with slight red Hugh. Aroma is big rum, raisins, a little cardboard in a good way, molasis. Taste is great, the alcohol is really well hidden, syrupy raisins, and burnt molasis, sweetness, oak, 
Big rum. A very nice big beer. I love this stuff with a year plus age on it.
Batch number two. Everything about this beer is phenomenal. One of the best beers I have consumed on recent history. Even the label is cool. Cant wait to have more

Bottled Sept. 6, 2013, batch #3. From J&K liquors. Sweet rum and molasses aroma with pumpkin and spice note including nutmeg and cinnamon. Pours cloudy, copper colored with no head or lacing. Sweet rum and molasses with the pumpkin and aforementioned spices coming through on the extremely smooth finish with just a hint of the booze, but nowhere near as boozy as expected. Delightful.

another bottle from tleaver33. pours amber with no head, looks flat. nose is strong of spiced rum. taste follows with a lot of booze heat. besides that the body has light carbonation, seems a tad thin.

Bottle from Isaac Newtons. First off, I have to say the pumpkin taste is not over bearing. This brew actually has a smooth pumpkin flavor, cinnamon, spice, wood, and caramel malt flavor. Alcohol is warming and again smooth. I loved it.

Pours clear amber without head. Sweet aroma with pumpkin, banana-marshmellows, alcohol.. Perhaps pisang ambon. It feels like the taste is really good all around, except for the slight fact that it contains pumpkin... I focus on the good parts though. Nice caramel. The alcohol makes a good substitute for the bubbles. Somewhat decent. Sorry for ratings this, pumpkin lovers..

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour a slightly hazy amber, with as good as no head at all. 
Aroma is really candied with "skumbanan", vanilla, rum, caramel, piecrust, toffee and the pumpkin comes through towards the end. Slight spices in the back of the throat. Adult candy, and this has some port Wine qualities to it. 
The taste is pretty darn sweet, with a slight bitterness to it, and faint spicy notes. Medium bodied, with a somewhat flat carbonation. However the booze makes a tickling sensation on the tongue. As with Avery, you cant taste the booze, but theres slight heat in the throat. Thanks to Doodler for sending med this bad boy.

Bottle pour. This might be the ultimate fall/winter sipping beer! Loads of pumpkin aroma right off the opening and lots of sweet juicy rum pumpkin flavors as this beautiful liquid goes down. Amazing! Cheers!
Amber with a low white head - Aroma is of sweet malts and spice - Good malt body to support all the spices, and it is bit sweet as well - Good amlt finish that olso has a lot of spice - this was good

Wow! Best smelling beer Ive ever had! Smells like pumpkin aged with rum, smelt immediately upon opening! What a blast of a beer! Pumpkin, rum, pumpkin pie, whipped cream, cheesecake, toffee, butterscotch, candy cane, toffee...in that order. Sweet desert beer...very heavy...thousand pound beer! Rich aroma and taste...what a treat folks! Buy it...no exceptions to cost!

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2014 Sample at Fauxbab. Damn good stuff. Pumpkin spice, vanilla, cinnamon, and lots of rum. Quite smooth. Avery does a great job with all their BA stuff, no exception.

2013 bottle, just over a year old now. Mellowed out quite a bit. Still very boozy. But its an 18.5% beer. Not much pumpkin, lots of rum and vanilla

Bottle from Beer Run. Hazy brownish red pour with a tiny head that quickly fades. The nose is strong bruised banana. A bit of vanilla, cinnamon cake. Mild booze. Dark red berries, somewhat earthy dirty. The taste is strongly hot and sweet. Banana and pumpkin pie. Rich red fruits. Strong yeasty sweetness. Brown sugar, banana bread. More cinnamon. Hot finish, a splash of rum. Full, oily body, very soft carbonation. Overall, definitely unique, flavorful. A pretty good nightcap.

Pretty wild. Very high abv. Alcohol hides very well. Flavors of pumpkin, cinnamon, apple, rum, woody. Pretty dynamic. Definitly a sipper.. and worth to try at least once especially when it is the season

Tap at Avery. Pours a murky red-orange brown with minimal, rapidly settling head, no lacing. Aroma is sweet, alcohol, oaky, and rum. Flavor is quite sweet, mild pumpkin, moderate rum, with a sweet, alcohol finish and an oaky aftertaste. This beer hides the alcohol very well, though the rum tones come through stronger than I recall. Moderate carbonation, medium body, and a mildly warming finish. A very good, sweet, big pumpkin beer.

By far the best of the pumpkin...or is it the best of the rums? In any case this is a great beer. The high ABV is not as noticeable as one would fear. With all this there is still a good pumpkin taste with well balanced spices.

The aroma is ripe bananas, the appearance is iced tea with no head. The taste reinforces the banananess. The finish is smooth, not what you'd expect with 18% ABV.

---Cheers until next time!
DMSR

Bottle - Pours dark amber with a little white head. Lots of pumpkin, cinnammon, and all spice in the nice plus sweet rum. Very malty almost like an Avery Samael plus some pumpkin and spices. Considering the alcohol its decently balanced and smooth.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 Bottle from 2011 - its October. Its going to snow tomorrow. Time to break this bad boy out. Big rum nose with some spices present. Hazy dark, dark amber pour with almost no head. Smooth pumpkin, clove and vanilla give way to rum and some heat. Really a wonderful beer.

Heavy aromas of malted barely, coconut, pumpkin pie, massive licorice, dark fruits, plums, toffee, rum, oak wood and slick molasses. Deep, mocha brown color with an instantly vanishing foam and no lacing whatsoever. Massive and intense flavors immediately attack the palate. Upfront there is heavy rum, booze, malted barley, toffee and a strong amber or munich tasting malt. The secondary phase brings a very sticky, slick flavor of molasses, an off-sweet caramel, sweet sugar, candied cherries and a skunky cough syrup note dancing around the palate. The finish leaves a continuous alcohol burn, rum, spice, resin and pumpkin pie flavor on the back of the throat. Overall, this is a fantastic piece of work. My only complaint is that the pumpkin is overwhelmed by the rum barrels. Besides that, this is another malt forward monster from Avery. Really fantastic stuff. Definitely a sipping beer. A+ rating.

Special tapping at Avery's for GABF 2013. 

Orange amber pour, very dark; with a light brown head. Pumpkin aroma is very strong. The taste gives you a strong kick of pumpkin, light oak, and a spicy after taste. This beer is very sweet, probably necessary to carry 18% abv. Overall this pour is great, have to be in the mood of pumpkin though.

A relaxing brew. Strong rum aroma up front with sweetness. Nice brown color with a little red mixed in. Small off-white head. Viscous oily palate with mild carbonation as this was at least a year and a half old. Strong blend of flavors. The rum and wood cover up the pumpkin quite bid. Sweet caramel and spices where in the back. Alcohol was hard to hide on this one. Sipper all the way.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 12 oz bottle shared. Strong pumpkin, spice juice. Full thick syrupy body, with a smooth cinnamon finish. An excellent sipper.  Update:  On tap at The Mayor. 2014 vintage.  Clear amber with a beige head.  Similar.  3.9 ish overall this time.  Syrupy.  848415

2011 12oz bottle in a tulip. Pours deep brown/amber with a beige head. Aroma of rum, some pumpkin and spices, and caramel and darker malts, and a little alcohol. Flavor the same with the bottle probably a little too old to enjoy. Average to smooth texture. A decent beer, would like to try fresh.

I had this beer poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass.

A: Deep Amber/Orangish Hue, Passes MinimS:al Light, Off White Foamy Head that disappates into a ring, Minimal Lacing

S: Rum, Bourbon, Mild Sweet Potato
